group_1.narration: It's been many years since I lost my father.

group_1.textLeft: Here, let's see him off with the proper flowers.
Your father will always be watching over you,@Rabi-chan.

group_1.textRight: After rising into the sky, he will return to you@as a single drop of rain.
Along with the memories in your heart,@your dad will remain by your side.

group_1.textCenter: Back then, several people who were there for@me reached out to me.
But I was too consumed by grief to be able to@hear what they were trying to say.
Even when some emotion did stir within me,@it was more like, "What do you know about me?"
Or an anger that they should stop saying such@inappropriate things.
Still, I didn't need them to understand my feelings...

group_1.textRight: I used to get teased about it, no kidding.
'Cause I'd go into stores looking dirty, I often@got the cold shoulder.
But there were a lot of people who helped me,@and that helped my family.

group_1.textLeft: Just having a connection with the outside world@could very well bring about change...
The three of us are all prisoners in the same cell,@with nobody coming to visit us.

group_1.textRight: Currently, nobody knows or understands our@sorrow and suffering.

group_1.textCenter: I know people are intolerant of what they don't@understand.
But I still wish I had someone to sympathize@with me...
Though we'll never be understood, though we'll@never be freed from our fate,
I want something to comfort me, even if it's merely@a small consolation...

group_1.textLeft: Here, let's see him off with the proper flowers.
Your father will always be watching over you,@Rabi-chan.

group_1.textRight: After rising into the sky, he will return to you@as a single drop of rain.
Along with the memories in your heart,@your dad will remain by your side.

group_1.textCenter: I was saved by others despite my inner turmoil...@Even amidst my father's passing...
Here and now, I crave fleeting sympathy or@even just feeble encouragement...
